sub_title: Architect | Mathematician | Interdisciplinary researcher | Instructor | Permitted to work in NL
summary:
Highly motivated architecture researcher with a passion for bridging architectural academic research and mathematical thinking methods to explore interdisciplinary approaches to develop innovative solutions to upcoming challenges posed by the continuous advancements in artificial intelligence. Capable of assuming leadership positions in academia, establishing research agendas engaging in multidisciplinary collaborations, and assuming accountability for research and teaching advancements. Teaching in higher education with a good track record. Continuously strives to grow as an individual and contribute to the teams’s success.

Interdicsiplinary studies
Mathematics, Architecture, Using mathematical concepts to explain architectural concepts 

Mathematical thinking in 
design process
Mathematical thinking, algorithmic thinking
Data Analysis & Visualization
Quantitative Data Analysis and Network Analysis, Bibliometric analysis, VOSviewer

Curriculum Development
Developing, Applying, and 
Evaluating Teaching and Learning Initiatives


History of Architecture
Islamic architecture, Styles of architecture in Iran and Anatolia,
Sacred Architecture	

Teaching and Supervision
Teaching and Mentoring in Higher Education at the Bachelor level



3D Modeling and Rendering
Autodesk Revit, Archicad, Rhinoceros, Grasshopper,  AutoCAD, Sketch-up

Organizing collaboration
Designing workshops, Bringing different disciplines together to discover new concepts and new connections

Visual Communication
Sketching, Photoshop, and Visual Collaboration in Miro and Teams

Basic Design Studio I & Basic Design Studio II (EUT 111) & (EUT 112) 
Introducing basic design concepts to new students through two-dimensional design components, including line, shape, color, texture, relief, and surface design. Directing first-year students to gain the ability to create three-dimensional elements, including solid, void, mass, and volume. 

•	Developer and Tutor 
Mythology and Iconography (EUT241)
Providing the study of myths, legends, and symbols in various cultures throughout history through a combination of lectures, discussions, and research assignments to reveal the ways in which concepts of mythology and iconography continue to influence contemporary society.

•	Developer and Tutor 
Model and Prototype Development (EUT116)
Providing students with the opportunity to explore different materials and manufacturing methods and gain an understanding of the factors that influence the selection of materials and processes for specific applications. Students also learn how to analyze and optimize their designs for performance, cost, and sustainability.

•	Administrative Duties
